karamichellex: I am so grateful for getting through my university course, and being able to graduate tomorrow. My Dad was diagnosed with lung cancer when I was in year 12, which fucked up me in my exams, and then passed away in my first year of uni. I've been through so much shit and tomorrow I get to walk across the stage with high disctinctions and I'm so proud of myself for getting through everything
tootlepip72: I'm grateful for my health, my home & my support network. I work in a hospital & today I met a patient who, once he is discharged, has nowhere to go and no belongings. His wallet, his tent(which is his home) & all his clothing has been stolen while he has been unwell. This man just wanted to be listened to, so that's what I did for 5 minutes. Just 5 minutes out if my day meant so much to him & he was so grateful. But what he doesn't know is that his story has impacted me so much. I have worked in community services for over ten years & heard these kinds of stories over & over, but I needed to hear this one today. Thank you mate, for making me stop & think how bloody fortunate I am to live my life the way I do. 💗
